info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 14 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL MONTGOMERY AND WEST CENTRAL BUCKS COUNTIES... At 453 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lansdale, or 18 miles northwest of Philadelphia, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Phoenixville, Lansdale, Perkasie, Doylestown, Souderton, Collegeville, Royersford, Chalfont, Trappe, Hatfield, Dublin, Schwenksville, Fricks, Spring Mount, Skippack, Telford, Sellersville, Spring City, North Wales and New Britain. This includes Northeast Extension between mile markers 27 and 36. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
